page.title: 02Longlands Farm;Nether Silton
page.content: The present day farmer is well educated.Many have been to college or even university and are specialists in many fields.A number of farmer's sons in this locality have brought new ideas and methods back after a spell at college.Some farms have even got into the computer age. On my farm of 330 acres (which is larger than average in size) we have tractors of up to 200 horse power.We have, amongst other machinery, our own combine harvester,baler,forager,manure and fertiliser spreaders,drill,fork lift truck and trailers. 248 head of cattle are kept,83 of these being a herd of milking cows.1140 litres of milk is produced daily which is collected by a tanker and taken to a dairy in Northallerton 7 miles away. Sheep are reared principally for meat.
